| A riding pseudodragon:* has no hands.
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* can be [tamed by feeding](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic").
* wanders randomly.
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* likes gems.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                                   |

A **riding pseudodragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is a [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [dragon-like](/index.php?title=Dragon_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") creature that is the first type of [pseudodragon](/wiki/Pseudodragon "Pseudodragon") to be usable as a [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed"). Riding pseudodragons have a tendency to wander, will pick up [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A riding pseudodragon has a bite attack and a weak [breath weapon](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon") similar to that of [half-dragons](/wiki/Half-dragon "Half-dragon").

## Generation

Riding pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A [pseudodragon](/wiki/Pseudodragon_\(dNetHack\) "Pseudodragon (dNetHack)") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a riding pseudodragon, and a riding pseudodragon can grow up into a [large pseudodragon](/wiki/Large_pseudodragon "Large pseudodragon").

Half-dragon [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") and male half-dragon [Nobles](/wiki/Noble "Noble") start each game with a [saddled](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle") riding pseudodragon.

## Origin

Pseudodragons originate from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Riding_pseudodragon\&action=edit)*

html:
Riding pseudodragon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
D riding pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 8
Attacks Bite 2d4 physical, Breath weapon 1d3 half-dragon breath
D riding pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Bite 2d4 physical, Breath weapon 1d3 half-dragon breath

Base level 6
Base experience 105
Speed 12
Base AC 2
Base MR 2
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1500
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

A riding pseudodragon:

  • has no hands.
  • is carnivorous.
  • can be tamed by feeding.
  • wanders randomly.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A riding pseudodragon, D, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is a carnivorous and domestic dragon-like creature that is the first type of pseudodragon to be usable as a steed. Riding pseudodragons have a tendency to wander, will pick up gold and gems, and can be seen via infravision.

A riding pseudodragon has a bite attack and a weak breath weapon similar to that of half-dragons.

Generation

Riding pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A pseudodragon can grow up into a riding pseudodragon, and a riding pseudodragon can grow up into a large pseudodragon.

Half-dragon Knights and male half-dragon Nobles start each game with a saddled riding pseudodragon.

Origin

Pseudodragons originate from Dungeons & Dragons, where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.
Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Riding_pseudodragon&oldid=161675"

A '''riding pseudodragon''', {{brightblue|D}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. It is a [[carnivorous]] and [[domestic]] [[Dragon (dNetHack)|dragon-like]] creature that is the first type of [[pseudodragon]] to be usable as a [[steed]]. Riding pseudodragons have a tendency to wander, will pick up [[gold]] and [[gem]]s, and can be seen via [[infravision]].

A riding pseudodragon has a bite attack and a weak [[breath weapon]] similar to that of [[half-dragon]]s.

==Generation==
Riding pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A [[Pseudodragon (dNetHack)|pseudodragon]] can [[grow up]] into a riding pseudodragon, and a riding pseudodragon can grow up into a [[large pseudodragon]].

Half-dragon [[Knight]]s and male half-dragon [[Noble]]s start each game with a [[saddle]]d riding pseudodragon.

==Origin==
Pseudodragons originate from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.
